result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie M. Decker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample.
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week.

timeConds.notes: I&S MCJ to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie M. Decker

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  9:49 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CF1056, 21CM76, 21CM475, 21CM861, 22CF203, CCF565, 22CM354, 22CT221.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for ADA Mayo.  
Defendant appears in person with Atty Joseph Kaupie. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CF1056>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants. 
Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>Court grants. 

21CM76>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Operating While Revoked)>>Court grants. 

21CM475>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Operating While Revoked)>>Court grants.
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants. 

21CM861>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants. 

22CF203>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony)>>Court grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 6 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>Court grants. 

22CF565>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony)>>Court grants.
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony)>>Court grants.
Count 4 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC)>>Court grants. 
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 6 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 7 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.

22CM354>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor)>>Court grants.

22CT221>>State moves to DRI:  
Count 1 (Operating While Revoked)>>Court grants. 

PLEA: 

21CF1056 Count 2 (Operating While Revoked)>>NO CONTEST.  

21CM861 Count 1 (Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property <=$2500)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF203 Count 5 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 
22CF203 Count 7 (Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription)>>NO CONTEST. 

22CF565 Count 3 (Possession of THC/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CM354 Count 1 (Operating While Revoked 4th+)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on all counts: SWH for 2 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  60 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

COURT grants 21 days credit in 22CF203 and 4 days credit in 22CF565, if revoked.  

Adj: 10:10 a.m.
Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - AMENDED 07-29-2022
Intake Report- Marathon County Pretrial Services  - Completed 05-24-2022
